page.title: 03Industry and Housing
page.content: Most of the houses in our area were built in the 1930's and 1940's.This means that the majority of our homes are 40 or 50 years old.There is not much new housing in our area and surprisingly in our block there was not one tower block. The typical 1930s house is two storeys with wooden or metal window frames.Most are built in terraces of six or eight but some are semi-detached.All are brick built.Nearly all the factories around our area are foundries which means they make or work metal.One factory close to our school makes cutlery,another makes components for the motor industry.Also in our area we have what is probably the oldest hand rolling mill in England making steel mostly for export.
